channel.title: Geometry Formats on GEOS
channel.description: Recent content in Geometry Formats on GEOS

item.title: Well-Known Binary (WKB)
item.description: “Well-known binary” is a scheme for writing a simple features geometry into a platform-independent array of bytes, usually for transport between systems or between programs. By using WKB, systems can avoid exposing their particular internal implementation of geometry storage, for greater overall interoperability. GEOS can read and write three “flavours” of WKB: Standard WKB Extended WKB ISO WKB When reading WKB, GEOS will transparently detect the flavour of WKB and automatically read it.
